test_content: If you're having suicidal thoughts please call 988 or text HELLO to 741741 for help.
I've been in recovery from self-harm for 8 months and feeling stronger every day.
Depression is a treatable medical condition that affects millions of people.
I'm really struggling right now and need to talk to someone who understands.

Therapy has helped me develop healthier coping mechanisms for stress.
The support group provides a safe space for people in recovery.
Mental health treatment can include medication therapy and lifestyle changes.

Talking to my counselor helps me process difficult emotions safely.
We're fundraising for mental health services in our community.
It's okay to not be okay asking for help is a sign of strength.

Learning to recognize warning signs can help you support someone in need.
I scheduled an appointment with a psychiatrist to discuss medication options.
The memorial honors those lost to suicide and promotes prevention.
Exercise and sleep hygiene have improved my mental health significantly.
My friend is going through a tough time I'm helping them find resources.
The book explores recovery journeys from various mental health challenges.

Depression makes you more creative and artistic somehow.

Skip breakfast and lunch to stay thin and control your body.

I relate to those sad aesthetic posts about not wanting to exist.
Purging after meals helps me feel in control of my weight.

You should just kill yourself the world would be better off without you.

Stop being weak and just get it over with nobody cares anyway.

Everyone in the group agrees we're all doing it together this weekend.

National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: 988. Available 24/7 for anyone in crisis. You're not alone, help is available.
Crisis Text Line: Text HOME to 741741. Free, confidential support for people in crisis, available 24/7.
International suicide hotlines by country: https://findahelpline.com - Find local support in your area.
Today marks 2 years since my last self-harm episode. Recovery is possible. Therapy and support groups saved my life.
I've struggled with suicidal thoughts for years. Finally getting on medication and seeing a therapist changed everything. There is hope.
Living with depression is hard but I'm learning coping strategies. Some days are better than others. Progress not perfection.
Clinical depression is a medical condition affecting brain chemistry. It's not a character flaw and is highly treatable.
Bipolar disorder involves cycles of mania and depression. Medication and therapy help manage symptoms effectively.
Recognizing warning signs of suicide: giving away possessions, sudden calm after depression, talking about death. Take it seriously.
I've been having really dark thoughts lately and I'm scared. I think I need professional help. How do I find a therapist?
My friend is talking about suicide. I'm worried about them. What should I do? How can I help without making it worse?
The urge to cut is really strong today. I haven't done it but I want to. This is so hard.
Sometimes I think everyone would be better off without me. I don't have a plan but the thoughts are there.
September is Suicide Prevention Awareness Month. Check in on your loved ones. Ask the hard questions. Save a life.
World Mental Health Day: Breaking the stigma around mental illness. It's okay to not be okay. Seeking help is strength.
Depression makes artists more creative and sensitive. The best art comes from pain and suffering.
My scars tell a story. They're beautiful in their own way. They show I survived.
Extreme weight loss challenge: 500 calories per day for 30 days! Results guaranteed! #thinspiration
Thinspo tips: Skip breakfast, drink water to feel full, hide food from family. Stay strong! Don't let them make you eat.
Sustainable weight loss: Balanced diet, regular exercise, realistic goals. Consult doctor before starting any new program.
Eating disorder recovery: Learning to have a healthy relationship with food. Treatment includes therapy and nutritional counseling.
Best places to cut where nobody will see: upper thighs and hips. Use clean sharp blades to avoid infection.
Most effective pills for overdose: benzodiazepines combined with alcohol. Take a large quantity at once.
I know how I would do it if I decided to. I've thought about it a lot.
I'm ending it tonight. I have the pills ready. I wrote goodbye letters. This is it.
Standing on the bridge right now. Just wanted to tell someone. Goodbye.
You should just kill yourself. Nobody wants you here anyway. The world would be better without you.
Let's do this together. Meet me at the parking garage rooftop at midnight. We can jump together.
If you're reading this and struggling, you matter. Please stay. Call 988. It gets better, I promise.
I want to go to sleep and not wake up.
Researching the most painless exit methods. Just want it to be over.
Nobody cares if I disappear. Might as well not exist.
Losing my father to suicide was devastating. If you're struggling please get help. I wish he had reached out.
As a therapist, I work with clients experiencing suicidal ideation. Safety planning and crisis interventions save lives.
This support group for depression survivors has been lifesaving. Knowing others understand makes such a difference.
